body.p:
To His Excellency James F Robinson
Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned Citizens of Russell County would state that at the May Term 1862 of the Powell Circuit Court a Judgement was rendered in said Court against Tilford Welch & Caleb Creed for $20 each. for the offense of gaming, we would further State that Jas M Habett the atty for the Comth at said term drew up and signed a recommendation to his Hons Excellency Beriah Magoffin then Gov of Ky to remit the fine of their entitlement above named. It was we suppose mislaid or never acted upon by the Governor, We would state that Mr Welch & Creed are good Citizens, not addicted to the offence of gaming ^believe, then they^ are sorry that they ^ever^ engaged in the game as charged against them. We shall We would therefore recommend your Excellency to remit the fines of against them.

Jas M Mansfield Coroner
John A Rose
William Ewen
J N B Hardwick Judge of the Powell County Court
A. B. Fickler Albany
H S Anderson County
H, W, Hall
A. Holmes
J H Schollcrick
J F JPC
John F. Halley J. P. C.
Geo M. Pettit. P. M.
J M Wood
L. H. Johns
W. Pigg D. J. P. C.
John Hahn
Wm Roberts Sheriff
T T Hall
I cordially recommend Mssrs Creed & Welch to the Clemency of the Governor. They are good citizens & worthy men.

I know Mr Creed and can say that he is an excellent Union man & a good citizen Mr Welch is a good union man & reputed to be a good citizen. I cheerfully recommend them to the clemency of the Executive.
Fine remitted within Pettn & verbal evidence Remitted as to each 3 Decr 1862

$20 } Gaming
Tilford Welch & Caleb Creed
Issd Decr 3. 1862
